fields.text_html:
Welcome

This is an experiment in the economics of decision-making. The instructions are simple, and if you follow them carefully and make good decisions, you can earn a considerable amount of money, which will be paid to you privately at the end of the experiment.

In this experiment, you are Person #player_number#.

You have a house, a field, and the avatar you chose earlier in the Town. Your house and field are colored green and have the number #player_number# next to them. Houses, fields, and avatars belonging to others are colored gray.

You and the other #player_count-1# people in this experiment each produce two fictitious items: #good_one# and #good_two#. Fields, the domino-shaped rectangles, produce goods every period. Each period has two phases, a #production_length# second "production" phase and a #move_length# second "move" phase. During the production phase, goods will grow in the fields. You and the other participants can move the produced goods during the move phase. The experiment will have many periods.

We will describe how this process works next.

Continue to the next page of the instructions by pressing the Next   button.

Move Phase

After the production phase is complete, the #move_length# second move phase will begin. During this time, you and the other participants in the experiment can move goods.

You will only earn money for the goods located in your house at the end of the move phase. The Period Earnings frame on the right side of your screen explains how you earn money. For each set of #good_one_count# #good_one# and #good_two_count# #good_two# you have in your house, we will pay you #good_earnings#¢ at the end of each period.

To move goods, click your field. With the mouse button still down, drag the transfer line to your house. A pop-up will appear asking how many goods you would like to transfer. 

Try moving some goods from your field to your house. Do this now.

Notice how the computer updated the "Current value of goods in your house" in the Period Earnings frame.

You cannot transfer goods from a house to a field.

Once the move phase is complete, the computer will remove all of the goods in the fields and houses. The computer will not count any goods in your house that are over the ratio defined in the period earnings towards your earnings. The next period will begin with a new production phase.

Production Phase

For the first #production_length# seconds of each period, your field will produce #good_one# and #good_two# goods. Your field's production settings determine the rate at which your field produces these two goods. You can find your production settings on the right side of your screen. Try moving the scroll bar in this section. Notice that you can change the proportion of production time devoted to producing one good or the other. The more time you devote to producing a good, the more your field will make that good, at the expense of the other, in any given period. To lock in your production change, press the Update Production   button.

In the bottom left corner of this window, press the Simulate Production   button to see an example of how your field will produce goods given the production settings you have. Do this now.

Try changing the production settings to get a feel for how they affect your field's production.

Once the experiment begins, you can update your production settings at any time during the move phase.

Once you have practiced producing goods a few times, continue to the next page.

Chat

You can chat with other participants in the experiment using the chat box at the bottom of the town frame. You can either send a message to everyone or an individual person using the toggle buttons. If a new message is waiting for you, an asterisk(*) will appear on the toggle button. Do this now.

You are free to discuss any and all aspects of the experiment, with the following exceptions: you may not reveal your name, discuss side payments, make threats, or engage in inappropriate language (including such shorthand as ‘WTF’). If you do, you will be excused, and you will forfeit your earnings.

During the experiment, every #break_period# periods will be a break period in which nobody produces anything though the chat rooms are still open. 

Above the chatbox, Notices will appear about your production and transfer history.

Summary

Important points

  • The experiment will last many periods, consisting of a production and move phase.
  • Fields produce goods to the settings in the production frame.
  • Goods are moved by clicking and dragging the transfer line.
  • Goods are consumed in houses and converted to cents at the end of each move phase.
  • Any goods not consumed at the end of a period are destroyed.
  • You can discuss the experiment in the chat window with other participants.
  • Every #break_period# periods is a break period where no goods are produced but the chat remains open

This is the end of the instructions. If you have any questions, please raise your hand and a monitor will come by to answer them.  If you are finished with the instructions, please click the Start   button.  The instructions will remain on your screen until the experiment begins.  We need everyone to click the  Start   button before we can begin the experiment.
